SEARCH
Package domain

Class Square

java.lang.Object
domain.Square
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayToken, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldenSquare, MineSquare, NormalSquare, TeleportSquare
public abstract class Square extends Object implements PlayToken, Serializable
The Square class represents a square on the game board in a Gomoku game. It serves as the base class for different types of squares, such as normal squares and special squares. Each square can contain a token, and specific actions are performed when playing tokens on squares. Subclasses must implement the PlayToken interface and provide their own behavior for the 'act()' method.
Version:
1.8.5
Author:
Juan Daniel Murcia - Mateo Forero Fuentes

    • Square

      public Square(Board board, int row, int column)
      Constructs a Square with the specified board, row, and column.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board to which the square belongs.
      row - The row index of the square.
      column - The column index of the square.

  • Method Details

    • getSquareSubtypes

      public static Set<Class<? extends Square>> getSquareSubtypes()
      Gets the set of all subclasses of the Square class using reflection.
      Returns:
      The set of all subclasses of Square.

    • createSquareInstance

      public static Square createSquareInstance(Board board, int row, int column, boolean especial)
      Creates an instance of a Square based on the specified criteria. If the square is not special, it creates a NormalSquare; otherwise, it randomly selects a special square type.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board to which the square belongs.
      row - The row index of the square.
      column - The column index of the square.
      especial - A flag indicating whether the square is special.
      Returns:
      The created Square instance.

    • setToken

      public void setToken(Token token) throws GomokuException
      Sets the token on the square. If the token is not null, it attaches the square to the token and notifies observers.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to set on the square.
      Throws:
      GomokuException

    • playToken

      public void playToken(Token token) throws GomokuException
      Plays the specified token on the square and attaches the square to the token, notifying observers.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to play on the square.
      Throws:
      GomokuException

    • getTokenColor

      public Color getTokenColor()
      Gets the color of the token on the square.
      Returns:
      The color of the token, or null if no token is present.

    • getTokenValue

      public int getTokenValue()
      Gets the value of the token on the square.
      Returns:
      The value of the token, or 0 if no token is present.

    • act

      public abstract void act() throws GomokuException
      Performs the action associated with playing a token on the square. Subclasses must provide their own implementation of this method.
      Specified by:

      Throws:
      GomokuException
